text.__SUMMARY__:
The white-cheeked bullfinch (Pyrrhula leucogenis) is a species of finch in the family Fringillidae.
It is found only in the Philippines. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist montane forests.
text.Taxonomy:
The taxonomy was described in 2001 by Arnaiz-Villena et al. All birds belonging to Genus Pyrrhula have a common ancestor: Pinicola enucleator.
